intro:
A scientific field of study, Agriculture, Forestry, and Animal Sciences encompasses the study of plants, animals, and their habitats. Preservation of soil's mineral qualities, crop rotation, ecological balance, husbandry, forest restoration, natural resource management, food production, and ecosystem conservation are some of the subjects covered by the discipline. SUB-DISCIPLINES  Forestry Animal Sciences Agriculture Degrees in Agriculture, Forestry, and Animal Science offer varieties of benefits and career paths. Agriculture courses are highly interdisciplinary, requiring students to have a good grasp of both natural sciences and social sciences and drawing on areas such as biology, environmental sciences, chemistry, economics, and business management.

The term Forestry refers to the science or practice of planting, managing, conserving and maintaining forests and its associated resources with the aim to meets the goal of human benefit.” Therefore, the forest is an integral part of an ecosystem in which it requires professionals foresters to be involved in various activities or works regarding forestry. 

A career in animal science degree will give graduates liberating career options. The scope is not limited as graduates can become choose to become from Veterinarian and National Parks and Wildlife Services Officer to Animal Health Consultant and Quality Control Manager.
